questions.question: 1. Which of the following is true?

answers.a: A tree can be traversed in a linear fashion like arrays.
answers.b: A tree can be traversed only in breadth first order
answers.c: A tree can be traversed only in depth first order
answers.d: A tree can be traversed in both breadth first and depth first order.

explanations.a: Data of the tree is not stored in a linear fashion. Hence it cannot be traversed linearly.
explanations.b: There are more ways to traverse a tree, including breadth first traversal.
explanations.c: There are more ways to traverse a tree, including depth first traversal.

questions.question: 2. Which of the following is true about Breadth First Traversal?

answers.a: In breadth first traversal, nodes of the tree can be traversed in any manner
answers.b: In breadth first traversal, nodes of the tree are traversed level by level, left to right
answers.c: In breadth first traversal, nodes of the tree are traversed depth wise

explanations.a: No, a proper set of rules are followed while traversing a tree using breadth first traversal.
explanations.b: Yes, direction can be from left to right, or from right to left, but should remain for the entire traversal.
explanations.c: If nodes are traversed depth-wise, then it is depth first traversal

questions.question: 3. Select an option which is TRUE?

answers.a: A traversal of a tree does not involve visiting all the nodes
answers.b: A traversal of a tree involves visiting all the nodes in the tree
answers.c: A search of a graph must visit all the nodes in the graph

explanations.b: Yes, traversing a tree means visiting each node in a specified order, covering all the nodes.
explanations.c: Search will stop once the node is found. Hence visiting all the nodes will not be possible all the time.
